textfields.tf: When the vehicle is unladen the ride clearance is greater than when loaded.
This function enshures that the ground clearance is sufficient even when the tyre pressure is low.
Thus the shipping space of a trailer can be a bit larger as it could be without this ECAS function.
Due to this function the overall height of the loaded vehicle is smaller than when unladen.
Please mark the right statements about the ECAS function "tyre deflection compensating".
This statement is true. The ride clearance is increased by the same value as the tyres are deflected due to the load weight.
This statement is wrong. The tyre deflection compensating serves the aim to increase the height of the shipping space.
This is correct. If the vehicle is unladen the ride clearance is kept very short to enable an increased overall height.
That´s not true. The overall height remains the same regardless of the load weight.
Exactly, you marked all right statements.
